availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Voltaire Loving (Bowling Green, KY, farmer, politician, attorney)

body.p: Bowling Green, Warren County, Kentucky, attorney, farmer, and politician. Nelson County, Virginia native. Attended the University of Virginia. Married to Amanda M. Graham Loving in January 1829. Father of A. Q. Loving, Hector V. Loving, Willie Loving, John A. Loving, and Laura Loving. Admitted to the bar in 1829. Served in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1840. Served in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1841 to 1844. Commonwealth's Attorney for the Sixth Judicial District from 1845 to 1849. Circuit Judge for the Sixth Judicial District from 1849 to 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Attorney in Bowling Green in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.
